byline.original: By CATHERINE SAINT LOUIS and STEPHANIE STROM

abstract: Food and beverage manufacturers object to proposal by Food and Drug Administration to list amount of added sugars as percentage of recommended calorie intake on nutrition labels of packaged foods; survey published in Journal of the Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics indicates that consumers would find new listing confusing and would be less likely to buy products with such labels.
lead_paragraph: The agency proposed that labels on packaged foods cite the amount of added sugars they contain as a percentage of the recommended daily calorie intake.

headline.main: F.D.A. Wants Food Labels to Quantify Added Sugars
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Wants Food Labels to Quantify Added Sugars

snippet: The agency proposed that labels on packaged foods cite the amount of added sugars they contain as a percentage of the recommended daily calorie intake.

keywords.value: Journal of the Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics
keywords.name: organizations
